title: `todo!()` macro breaks `cargo fix`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
# Note: The error happens on `cargo fix`, not on actual compilation ### Code ```Rust fn main() { } fn a() -> Vec { let b = { todo!(); vec![] }; b } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0 (84c898d65 2023-04-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 84c898d65adf2f39a5a98507f1fe0ce10a2b8dbc commit-date: 2023-04-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0 LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` (also tested on `1.70.0-beta.3` and `1.71.0-nightly`) ### Error output ``` Checking rust_project v0.1.0 (/home/momo/Coding/rust_project) warning: failed to automatically apply fixes suggested by rustc to crate `rust_project` after fixes were automatically applied the compiler reported errors within these files: * /home/momo/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/alloc/src/macros.rs * /home/momo/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/macros/mod.rs * src/main.rs This likely indicates a bug in either rustc or cargo itself, and we would appreciate a bug report! You're likely to see a number of compiler warnings after this message which cargo attempted to fix but failed. If you could open an issue at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues quoting the full output of this command we'd be very appreciative! Note that you may be able to make some more progress in the near-term fixing code with the `--broken-code` flag The following errors were reported: error[E0425]: cannot find value `b` in this scope --> src/main.rs:9:5 | 9 | b | ^ help: a local variable with a similar name exists: `_b` warning: unreachable expression --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 6 | todo!(); | ------- any code following this expression is unreachable 7 | vec![] | ^^^^^^ unreachable expression | = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default = note: this warning originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`. Original diagnostics will follow. warning: unreachable expression --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 6 | todo!(); | ------- any code following this expression is unreachable 7 | vec![] | ^^^^^^ unreachable expression | = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default = note: this warning originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) warning: unused variable: `b` --> src/main.rs:5:9 | 5 | let b = { | ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_b` | = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default warning: function `a` is never used --> src/main.rs:4:4 | 4 | fn a() -> Vec { | ^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: `rust_project` (bin "rust_project") generated 3 warnings (run `cargo fix --bin "rust_project"` to apply 1 suggestion) warning: failed to automatically apply fixes suggested by rustc to crate `rust_project` after fixes were automatically applied the compiler reported errors within these files: * /home/momo/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/alloc/src/macros.rs * /home/momo/.rustup/toolchains/stable-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/src/rust/library/core/src/macros/mod.rs * src/main.rs This likely indicates a bug in either rustc or cargo itself, and we would appreciate a bug report! You're likely to see a number of compiler warnings after this message which cargo attempted to fix but failed. If you could open an issue at https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues quoting the full output of this command we'd be very appreciative! Note that you may be able to make some more progress in the near-term fixing code with the `--broken-code` flag The following errors were reported: error[E0425]: cannot find value `b` in this scope --> src/main.rs:9:5 | 9 | b | ^ help: a local variable with a similar name exists: `_b` warning: unreachable expression --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 6 | todo!(); | ------- any code following this expression is unreachable 7 | vec![] | ^^^^^^ unreachable expression | = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default = note: this warning originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: aborting due to previous error; 1 warning emitted For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`. Original diagnostics will follow. warning: `rust_project` (bin "rust_project" test) generated 3 warnings (3 duplicates) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.34s [momo@momo-tower rust_project]$ cargo build Compiling rust_project v0.1.0 (/home/momo/Coding/rust_project) warning: unreachable expression --> src/main.rs:7:9 | 6 | todo!(); | ------- any code following this expression is unreachable 7 | vec![] | ^^^^^^ unreachable expression | = note: `#[warn(unreachable_code)]` on by default = note: this warning originates in the macro `vec` (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) warning: unused variable: `b` --> src/main.rs:5:9 | 5 | let b = { | ^ help: if this is intentional, prefix it with an underscore: `_b` | = note: `#[warn(unused_variables)]` on by default warning: function `a` is never used --> src/main.rs:4:4 | 4 | fn a() -> Vec { | ^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: `rust_project` (bin "rust_project") generated 3 warnings (run `cargo fix --bin "rust_project"` to apply 1 suggestion) Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.19s ```
Backtrace

``` there is no backtrace printed ```
